title: Thyronorm 25MCG Tab 1x30 (P)
details: Levothyroxine is used to treat an underactive thyroid (hypothyroidism).
precautions: Tell your doctor /Pharmacist your medical history of, Thyrotoxicosis, Decreased adrenal gland function, Coronary artery disease, Irregular heartbeat, Hypertension, Diabetes. Current information shows that this drug may be used during pregnancy. Levothyroxine passes into breast milk but is unlikely to harm a nursing infant. Consult your doctor before breast-feeding.
effects: Hair loss may occur during the first few months of treatment.

title: Thyronorm 100MCG Tab 1x30 (P)
details: Levothyroxine is used to treat an underactive thyroid (hypothyroidism).
precautions: Tell your doctor /Pharmacist your medical history of, Thyrotoxicosis, Decreased adrenal gland function, Coronary artery disease, Irregular heartbeat, Hypertension, Diabetes. Current information shows that this drug may be used during pregnancy. Levothyroxine passes into breast milk but is unlikely to harm a nursing infant. Consult your doctor before breast-feeding.
effects: Hair loss may occur during the first few months of treatment.

title: Thyronorm 25MCG Tab 1x100 (P)
details: This medication is used to treat Hypothyroidism.
precautions: Use with caution having increased thyroid hormones (thyrotoxicosis), Decreased adrenal gland function, heart disease, Hypertension, Diabetes.

title: Thyroxine 50MCG Tab 1x100 (L)
details:
Thyroxin medicine is a prescribed medication having the generic name of levothyroxine. It is a thyroid medicine that is used to replace a hormone.

Uses

Thyroxin tablet uses are described below.

Thyroxin medication is used
READ MORE
precautions: Thyroxin tablet precautions are described below.Before taking this medication, inform the doctor about your medical history. Also, inform the doctor if you are taking any supplements such as herbal supplements, etc.Before taking this medication, inform the doctor if you have any hypersensitivity problems such as allergic problems, rashes, itching, swelling, etc., from this medicine.To keep yourself inform, the doctor if you ever had thyroid nodules, and heart disease, anemia, drug allergies, etc. also, inform the doctor if you have ever taken radiation therapy of iodine.Thyroxin in pregnancy should be taken only if your doctor suggests you. As the dose in the pregnancy may change. Also, inform the doctor before taking this medication if you are in a breastfeeding condition.Complete the full course of this medication. Do not stop it in the middle.This medicine should be stored at room temperature, almost temperature at 20 to 25 degrees centigrade.Avoid the use of some products such as grapes fruit, infant soy formulas, cotton seeds, foods that contains a high amount of fiber, soybean flour, and walnuts.Avoid sharing this medicine with any other patient or person having even symptoms.Before taking medicine, check the expiry date of the medicine.Keep the medicine away from children and pet's reach.Use with caution having increased thyroid hormones (thyrotoxicosis), Decreased adrenal gland function, heart disease, Hypertension, Diabetes.
effects: Thyroxin medicine side effects are listed below.It can cause hypersensitivity problems such as fever, diarrhea,Â  vomiting, sweating, headache, chest pain, and irritability.It can cause shortness of breath or difficulty in taking a breath.It can also cause allergic reactions, skin rashes, hair loss, and dryness of the skin.Thyroxin can cause irregular heartbeat problems and tremors.Its side effects may lead to leg cramps and irregularity in menstrual periods.Thyroxin tablets may affect your weight change. Also, it can change the taste of your mouth and throat problem and increased appetite.
